text: The 1928 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1928 college football season. Head coach Babe Hollingbery led the team to a 4–3 mark in the PCC and 7–3 overall. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 22 | Whitman | Home | 33-6 W | 4,000 |- ! scope="row" | September 29 | Gonzaga | Away | 3-0 W | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 6 | Montana | Away | 26-6 W | 6,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 13 | California | Away | 3-13 L | 30,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 20 | Oregon State | Home | 9-7 W | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 27 | College of Idaho | Home | 51-0 W | 5,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 3 | Idaho | Away | 26-0 W | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 10 | UCLA | P | 38-0 W | 1,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 17 | USC | Away | 13-27 L | 50,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 29 | Washington | Away | 0-6 L | 30,000 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1928 in Washington (state)
